portal.title: Claude Learning Path
portal.subtitle: A 4-step journey to master Claude — from basics to advanced integrations. All 31 videos sourced exclusively from official Anthropic channels.

steps.title: Claude Basics
steps.summary: Discover Claude, learn the interface, and master the core features: Artifacts, Projects, Connectors, and Skills.
objectives: Understand what Claude is and navigate Claude.ai confidently
Create and iterate on Artifacts for documents, code, and interactive content
Use Projects to maintain persistent context across sessions
Create and use Skills to teach Claude your working preferences
checklist: Sign in to Claude.ai and complete your first conversation
Create one Artifact (document or interactive HTML)
Set up a Project with a custom instruction
Connect at least one external tool via Connectors
Create a Skill based on a recurring task

topics.title: Getting Started
topics.description: Set up your Claude account, understand the interface, and discover the Claude Sonnet 4.5 model's capabilities.

videos.title: Getting started with Claude.ai
videos.reason: Official walkthrough covering account setup, the chat interface, and your first prompts — the essential starting point for all learners.

questions.question: What is Claude primarily designed to do?
choices: Search the web and return links
Assist with writing, analysis, coding, and research through conversation
Compile and run programming code
Manage social media accounts
questions.explanation: Claude is Anthropic's conversational AI assistant, built to help with a wide range of tasks including writing, analysis, research, and coding — all through natural language.

questions.question: True or False: Claude retains memory of previous conversations by default.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: By default, Claude does not remember previous conversations. Each new chat starts fresh. Projects are the feature that allows context to persist across sessions.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT something Claude can do?
choices: Write and edit documents
Generate images from text descriptions
Analyze uploaded files
Help debug code
questions.explanation: Claude is a text-based AI and cannot generate images. For image generation you would need a separate tool like Midjourney or DALL-E.

videos.title: Getting the most out of Sonnet 4.5 in Claude.ai
videos.reason: Explains what makes Claude Sonnet 4.5 distinctive and how to use its advanced reasoning and extended thinking for complex professional tasks.

questions.question: What is Claude Sonnet 4.5 particularly optimized for?
choices: Simple, one-word answers
High-capability tasks requiring strong reasoning across complex work
Generating images and diagrams
Managing email inboxes
questions.explanation: Claude Sonnet 4.5 is designed for high-capability professional tasks, combining strong reasoning with broad knowledge to handle complex requests effectively.

questions.question: True or False: Claude Sonnet 4.5 can read and analyze uploaded files like PDFs and spreadsheets.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: Claude Sonnet 4.5 supports file uploads, allowing you to analyze PDFs, spreadsheets, images, and other documents directly within the conversation.

questions.question: Which feature allows Claude to remember your preferences and context across multiple conversations?
choices: Conversation history
Projects with custom instructions
The bookmarks tab
Auto-save settings
questions.explanation: Projects let you define custom instructions that Claude applies to every conversation within that project, effectively giving it persistent memory of your preferences.

topics.title: Core Features
topics.description: Master Artifacts, Projects, Connectors, and Skills — the four pillars that transform Claude from a chatbot into a persistent work assistant.

videos.title: Intro to Artifacts
videos.reason: Official guide to creating and managing Artifacts — Claude's ability to produce standalone documents, code, and interactive web content alongside your conversation.

questions.question: What are Artifacts in Claude?
choices: Saved conversation summaries
Standalone outputs like code, documents, or interactive web pages created alongside the chat
Image files attached to messages
Shared team workspaces
questions.explanation: Artifacts are distinct, reusable outputs Claude creates alongside your conversation — they can be code files, documents, HTML pages, or interactive apps you can preview and iterate on.

questions.question: True or False: You can iterate on an Artifact multiple times without losing your conversation history.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: Artifacts are independent of the conversation thread, so you can refine them across many messages while keeping the full conversation history intact.

questions.question: Which of the following can Claude produce as an Artifact?
choices: A shareable public link to a website
An interactive HTML/JavaScript component you can preview instantly
A PDF with embedded video
A new user account
questions.explanation: Claude can create interactive HTML/JavaScript Artifacts that you can preview directly in the chat — perfect for prototyping dashboards, calculators, or simple tools.

videos.title: Intro to Projects
videos.reason: Shows how Projects let you set persistent instructions and share documents with Claude so it always has the right context for your work.

questions.question: What is the main benefit of using Projects in Claude?
choices: Sharing your conversations publicly
Maintaining persistent context and custom instructions across all chats in that project
Storing files permanently in the cloud
Inviting external collaborators to co-edit responses
questions.explanation: Projects allow you to define custom instructions and upload reference documents that Claude will remember and use across every conversation in that project.

questions.question: True or False: You can add documents and files to a Project for Claude to reference in conversations.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: Projects support adding files and documents as context. Claude will reference these automatically in all conversations within the project.

questions.question: How many Projects can you create in Claude?
choices: Only one
Up to five
As many as you need for different workflows
Only with a paid plan
questions.explanation: You can create as many Projects as needed, each with its own instructions, files, and context — for example, separate projects for different clients or teams.

videos.title: Intro to Connectors
videos.reason: Introduces Connectors — the feature that links Claude to your external tools like Google Drive and GitHub so it can work with your real data.

questions.question: What do Connectors in Claude allow you to do?
choices: Connect Claude to other AI models
Link Claude to external tools like Google Drive or GitHub to work with your real data
Export conversations to email automatically
Schedule automated tasks on a calendar
questions.explanation: Connectors extend Claude's reach by giving it secure, authorized access to your external tools and data sources so it can reference live information.

questions.question: True or False: Using a Connector, Claude can directly access files stored in your Google Drive.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: With the Google Drive Connector enabled, Claude can read your documents and spreadsheets to use as context — no manual copy-pasting required.

questions.question: What is required to activate a Connector in Claude?
choices: Installing a separate desktop application
Authorizing the integration in your Claude account settings
Purchasing an enterprise license
Contacting Anthropic support
questions.explanation: Connectors are set up in your Claude account settings — you authorize the integration once, and Claude can then securely access that tool going forward.

videos.title: How to create a skill with Claude through conversation
videos.reason: Demonstrates how to create Skills — reusable instruction sets that teach Claude to handle recurring tasks exactly the way you want them done.

questions.question: What is a Skill in Claude?
choices: A built-in Claude feature that requires no setup
A custom instruction set that teaches Claude to perform a specific task your preferred way
A certification badge earned after completing training
A type of Artifact for code
questions.explanation: Skills are reusable instruction sets you create to encode exactly how Claude should handle a recurring task — like writing in your brand voice or formatting reports your way.

questions.question: True or False: Skills can be created simply through a natural conversation with Claude.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: You describe the task and your preferences in conversation, and Claude formalizes them into a reusable Skill — no technical setup needed.

questions.question: How do you invoke a Skill once it has been created?
choices: Re-explain all instructions at the start of every chat
Reference the Skill by name in your prompt
It activates automatically for every message
Download and install it as a browser extension
questions.explanation: After creating a Skill, you simply mention its name in a prompt and Claude will apply those specific instructions to the task — no repetition needed.

videos.title: Teach Claude your way of working using skills
videos.reason: Shows how to encode your personal working preferences — tone, format, structure — into Skills so Claude consistently delivers results exactly how you like them.

questions.question: What kind of preferences can you encode into a Claude Skill?
choices: Your favorite color and music
Your writing style, preferred formats, and workflow conventions
Your device settings and time zone
Your calendar and meeting schedule
questions.explanation: Skills are designed to capture professional working preferences — tone, output structure, formatting rules — so Claude delivers consistently styled results.

questions.question: True or False: Skills are only available to users on paid Claude plans.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: Skills are a standard Claude feature available to users for personalizing recurring tasks, regardless of plan tier.

questions.question: Why are Skills more efficient than repeating instructions in every conversation?
choices: They make Claude respond significantly faster
They eliminate the need to re-explain your preferences each time
They grant Claude access to the internet
They increase Claude's token limit
questions.explanation: Skills encode your preferences once so Claude applies them consistently — removing the repetitive overhead of explaining your style at the start of every chat.

steps.title: Claude for Work
steps.summary: Apply Claude across professional roles — engineering, HR, marketing, product, sales — and boost your everyday productivity.
objectives: Use Claude to draft, edit, and transform professional content
Apply Claude to role-specific tasks in your team or department
Leverage Claude's browsing integration to work faster in Chrome

checklist: Identify 3 recurring tasks in your role that Claude can help with
Use Claude to draft or rewrite a professional document
Install and test the Claude Chrome extension
Generate role-specific content (job description, proposal, brief, etc.)

Managing benefits enrollment systems
Automatically scheduling performance review meetings

videos.title: Claude for Marketing

questions.question: How can Claude help a marketing team increase content output?

questions.question: True or False: Claude can consistently apply a specific brand voice when creating content.
choices: True
False

videos.title: Claude for Sales
videos.reason: Illustrates how sales teams use Claude to craft personalized outreach, prepare for objection handling, and produce proposals and follow-up emails faster.

questions.question: How can Claude improve a sales team's outreach effectiveness?

False

questions.question: Which sales documents can Claude help create?

Proposals, call scripts, and personalized follow-up emails
CRM database schemas
Lead scoring algorithms
questions.explanation: Claude can draft compelling proposals, structured discovery call scripts, and personalized follow-up emails — helping reps spend more time selling and less time writing.

topics.title: Productivity Boosters

videos.title: Simplify your browsing experience with Claude in Chrome

questions.question: What does the Claude Chrome extension allow you to do?
choices: Replace Google Search entirely
Interact with web page content — summarize, explain, or analyze it — without leaving the browser
Download any web page as a PDF
Block advertisements on websites
questions.explanation: The Claude Chrome extension lets you highlight text on any page and instantly ask Claude to summarize, translate, or analyze it — keeping your workflow in one place.

questions.question: True or False: The Claude Chrome extension can summarize the entire content of a web page.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: The extension can read and summarize full web page content, saving significant time when reviewing long articles, reports, or documentation.

questions.question: How does the Claude Chrome extension improve research workflows?
choices: By automatically saving bookmarks to your account
By letting you ask questions about page content directly without manual copy-pasting
By syncing browser tabs across all your devices
By blocking distracting websites

videos.title: Create professional results across tools with Claude Sonnet 4.5
videos.reason: Demonstrates how Claude Sonnet 4.5 delivers consistent, high-quality professional outputs whether used in Claude.ai, via API, or through integrated tools.

questions.question: What does using Claude Sonnet 4.5 across multiple tools enable?
choices: Running Claude offline without internet access
Consistent, high-quality outputs regardless of which tool or integration you use
Automatic syncing with all your connected devices
Access to models from other AI providers
questions.explanation: Claude Sonnet 4.5 brings the same strong reasoning capabilities whether accessed via Claude.ai, the API, or third-party integrations — enabling reliable, professional results everywhere.

questions.question: True or False: Claude Sonnet 4.5 can format documents according to specific professional standards you describe.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: You can instruct Claude to follow specific formatting conventions — heading structures, citation styles, tone requirements — and it will apply them consistently throughout the document.

questions.question: What is the most important factor in getting consistently high-quality results from Claude Sonnet 4.5?
choices: Using the same browser every time
Providing clear, specific instructions and context in your prompts
Only working during business hours
Using the desktop app instead of the web version
questions.explanation: Regardless of the tool or integration, clear and specific prompts are the key to reliable outputs. Context and precision in instructions directly determine result quality.

steps.title: Power Features

topics.title: Research & Artifacts
topics.description: Explore Claude's agentic research capabilities and its ability to build interactive tools and AI-powered apps using Artifacts.

videos.title: Using Research
videos.reason: Official guide to Claude's Research feature — an agentic mode that searches multiple sources and delivers comprehensive, cited answers to complex questions.

questions.question: What does Claude's Research feature do?
choices: Returns a curated list of Wikipedia articles
Searches multiple sources agentically and delivers comprehensive, cited answers
Connects to your internal company database
Summarizes only documents you have personally uploaded
questions.explanation: Research is an agentic capability where Claude proactively searches multiple web sources, synthesizes information, and returns a well-cited, comprehensive answer — far beyond a simple web search.

questions.question: True or False: Claude's Research feature always includes citations for every source it draws from.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: Research outputs include citations so you can verify information, click through to original sources, and explore further — essential for professional and analytical use cases.

questions.question: When is the Research feature most valuable to use?
choices: For simple questions with a single well-known answer
For complex questions requiring synthesis from multiple sources and perspectives
For writing creative fiction
For generating and running code
questions.explanation: Research shines on complex, multi-faceted questions — competitive analysis, policy summaries, market research — where a good answer requires drawing from many different sources.

videos.title: Using Research and Google Workspace
videos.reason: Shows how combining Research with the Google Workspace Connector lets Claude draw from both your internal documents and the live web in a single query.

questions.question: What key benefit does combining Research with Google Workspace provide?
choices: It replaces Google Docs entirely
Claude can draw from both your internal Drive files and external web sources in a single query
It automatically shares documents with your team
It converts spreadsheets into presentation slides
questions.explanation: The combination is powerful because Claude can simultaneously reference your private internal documents from Drive and search the web — giving you internal + external intelligence in one answer.

questions.question: True or False: You can ask Claude to compare a competitor's public pricing with your own internal pricing document stored in Google Drive.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: This is exactly the kind of query Research + Google Workspace unlocks — combining private internal context (your Drive doc) with public external information (competitor's web pages) in one response.

questions.question: Which type of query benefits most from combining Research with Google Workspace?
choices: Writing a simple internal memo
Reconciling internal strategy documents with external market trends and competitor intelligence
Formatting a slide presentation
Creating a basic spreadsheet formula
questions.explanation: The combined power is best when you need to bridge internal knowledge (your company's documents) with external information (market data, competitor research) in one coherent, synthesized answer.

videos.title: Use Artifacts to visualize and create AI apps without writing code
videos.reason: Demonstrates how anyone — without coding knowledge — can build interactive charts, dashboards, and mini-apps using Claude Artifacts.

questions.question: What can Claude create as an Artifact that users can interact with directly?
choices: Static PDF reports
Interactive HTML/JavaScript applications and data visualizations
Executable Python scripts that run on your machine
Database queries
questions.explanation: Claude can build interactive HTML/JavaScript Artifacts — charts, dashboards, calculators, forms — that you can use, test, and iterate on directly inside the chat.

questions.question: True or False: You need programming knowledge to ask Claude to create an interactive Artifact.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: Claude handles all the code. You just describe what you want in plain language, and Claude builds the interactive Artifact. No technical knowledge required.

questions.question: What is the key advantage of building tools with Claude Artifacts compared to traditional software development?
choices: Artifacts run on dedicated cloud servers with unlimited scale
You can prototype and iterate on ideas in minutes without writing code yourself
Artifacts are automatically deployed to the App Store
Artifacts have unlimited user capacity
questions.explanation: The main advantage is speed — you describe an idea, Claude builds it, and you can immediately test and iterate. What might take a developer hours takes Claude minutes.

videos.title: Prototype AI-Powered Apps with Claude Artifacts
videos.reason: Advanced look at building AI-powered interactive Artifacts with forms, dynamic inputs, and processing logic — without any developer involvement.

questions.question: What makes an Artifact 'AI-powered' in the context of this tutorial?
choices: It is hosted on an Anthropic cloud server
It incorporates interactive logic that responds dynamically to user inputs
It requires an API key to function
It automatically connects to the internet
questions.explanation: An AI-powered Artifact is one with interactive logic — forms, conditional outputs, dynamic processing — built by Claude so non-developers can create useful internal tools quickly.

questions.question: True or False: Artifacts created with Claude can include interactive forms that process user input.
choices: True
False
questions.explanation: Claude can build Artifacts with input fields, buttons, and processing logic — making them suitable as quick internal tools like calculators, generators, or checklist apps.

questions.question: Which workflow best describes prototyping an app with Claude Artifacts?
choices: Write code → test locally → push to GitHub
Describe the app in chat → Claude builds it → refine iteratively
Request a quote from a developer → approve budget → wait for delivery
Submit a ticket to your IT team and wait
questions.explanation: The Artifact prototyping loop is: describe → Claude builds → you review → request changes → repeat. It's extremely fast and requires no technical setup.

choices: True
